name: CYLiX - "alpha" cd . . . (No shipping costs!)
description:
The debut album is released by the german label "Life is Painful records". The cd is mastered by Len Lemeire (x Front 242, Implant) and includes bonus remixes from LIGHTS OF EUPHORIA and PSYCHE!
The album climbed no 30 @ poponaut store sales and gained enthousiastic reviews!

Digipack case - 24 pages booklet.

NO SHIPPING COST!

Tracklist:

01. Enter  (02:12)
02. So Much for Love  (04:16)
03. Miles Divide  (04:40)
04. Heal Me  (05:51)
05. Don't Let Me Fade  (04:53)
06. Keine Zeit  (05:45)
07. In My Veins  (04:44)
08. Deepest Fear  (05:54)
09. Exit  (03:05)
10. So Much For Love  (Lights Of Euphoria Cafe Mix) (03:37)
11. Heal Me  (Psyche Afterhours Mix) (06:00)

name: Modern Synthpop vol.1 - "compilation" cd . .  (No shipping costs!)
description:
US cd compilation feat. CYLiX 
Folder case

NO SHIPPING COST!

Tracklist:

1. Look – Elevated Sins
2. When You Were Mine (Feat. Estatuas De Sol) – Brand New Day
3. You Don’t Belong To Me – Never Enough
4. Miles Divide – Cylix
5. In My Place – Etage Neun
6. 1985 – Tycho Brahe
7. Never See In Your Eyes – Union Of Intentions
8. Change (US Version) – Erotic Elk
9. Paradise For Free (Sthilmann Electrolight Remix) – Vision Talk
10. Sensational (Synthetik FM Remix) – Hypersoul
11. Solarchaser – Syrian
12. Your Trip – Inner Conflict
13. Dancing With Robots – Electraset
14. If I Ruled The World – Destination
15. Light In A Mirror – Blind Faith & Envy
16. Reaching (Elevated Sins Remix) – Saudade
17. Fool’s Gold – Rupesh Cartel
18. Waiting – Avenpitch


SIDE LINE review
Sytnh-pop is back and is progressively starting to get back to its past status. This new sampler released by BND Productions (the label set up by and for Brand New Day) is a recommended sampler for all synth-pop fans. The sampler opens with Elevated Sins and Brand New Day both signed on BND Productions. The quite power-pop like "When You Were Mine" from Brand New Day is a pretty well-crafted song. Things start to get really interesting with Cylix and their "Miles divide"-song reminding to De/Vision. (.... ) "Modern Synthpop" is an adequate and right title perfectly representing the current generation of synthpop! This sampler hasn't been released by the most famous and familiar label, but the content is absolutely gorgeous!
(DP:8)DP.

http://www.side-line.com/reviews_comments.php?id=45328_0_17_0_C
